title: With Comey Indictment, Trump Gets Retribution but Shatters Norms
summary: A prosecutor’s drive to indict James Comey trampled over the Justice Department’s long tradition of keeping a distance from politics and the White House, and raised the prospect of more arbitrary charges.

title: At U.N., China Casts Itself as Defender of International Order
summary: Li Qiang, China’s second-highest-ranking official, portrayed Beijing as stable leader at a time when President Trump is pulling back from international institutions.

title: Gunman Who Attacked Midtown Office Building Had C.T.E.
summary: Shane Tamura, a former high school football player, shot himself and left behind a note that said his motive was anger at the N.F.L.

title: Trump Will Slap Tariffs on Imported Drugs, Trucks and Household Furnishings
summary: The president said his tariffs would range from 25 to 100 percent and go into effect next week.

title: Wary European Drugmakers Think They Can Avoid Trump’s Latest Tariffs
summary: European companies, a major source of U.S. medicines, are hopeful that their investments and trade deals with the U.S. will spare them from President Trump’s latest tariff barrage.

title: Trump’s New Tariffs Shock Countries Reeling From His Chaotic Trade War
summary: Throughout Asia, the source of about 40 percent of U.S. imports, countries have little to show for weeks of talks trying to finalize deals.

title: Who Pays for U.S. Tariffs, and Where Does the Money Go?
summary: President Trump is seeking to raise federal revenue by imposing levies on goods from foreign nations. Here’s how the process works.

title: In ‘Punch’ on Broadway, Trying to Summon Empathy for the Unforgivable
summary: The Broadway play “Punch” retells the true story of a fatal blow and how restorative justice brought healing to the parents and to the young man who threw the punch.

title: NASA Artemis II Astronauts Aim to Make Space Great for All
summary: In a preview of their flight, the crew of Artemis II, three Americans and a Canadian, struck a tone that veered away from the political currents of the moment.

title: Judge Rejects Lawsuit Claiming Art Had Lost Its ‘Oomph’
summary: The collector’s holding companies had sued his insurers for $400 million to cover paintings that they say had been damaged in a fire. The insurers said they had survived untouched.

title: Filmmaker Joshua Oppenheimer Turns His Camera on History’s Villains
summary: Joshua Oppenheimer’s films show the political value of empathy in our polarized age.

title: Marketing Movies Is Harder Than Ever. And Here Comes ‘One Battle After Another.’
summary: The film is the kind that isn’t supposed to work in theaters anymore. But Warner Bros., the studio behind it, has successfully bucked trends for months now.

title: New York Film Festival Highlights
summary: This year’s highlights include Jim Jarmusch’s “Father Mother Sister Brother,” the Italian documentary “Below the Clouds” and the epic “Magellan.”

title: A Broad Wave of Firings Followed Charlie Kirk’s Assassination
summary: More than 145 people in a wide range of occupations have been fired or disciplined after they made statements about the assassination of Charlie Kirk.

title: 5 Dairy Myths That Make Experts Sour
summary: We surveyed leading nutrition experts to reveal the truth about raw milk, lactose intolerance, low-fat dairy and more.

title: Mamdani Foes, Struggling to Raise Money, Have Started Buying Attack Ads
summary: Several super PACs that oppose Zohran Mamdani’s candidacy for mayor of New York City have banded together to coordinate attack ads.

title: Assata Shakur Dies at 78; Convicted Revolutionary Found Refuge in Cuba
summary: A member of a militant Black group, she was found guilty in the 1973 murder of a New Jersey state trooper, escaped from prison and fled to Cuba, where she taught and wrote.

title: Trump Can’t Be the One to Pick Who’s Indicted
summary: The Justice Department and the attorney general are supposed to keep a distance from the president, not be his personal score settlers.

title: This Town’s Minerals Make A.I. Possible. Then Came Hurricane Helene.
summary: Spruce Pine, N.C., supplies the world’s highest-purity quartz, a mineral that keeps the A.I. revolution afloat. What are the consequences?

title: Political Interference at the Justice Department
summary: We examine James Comey’s indictment and an investigation into George Soros’s foundation.

title: ICE Officer ‘Relieved of His Duties’ After Pushing Woman to Floor
summary: The Department of Homeland Security said it was investigating an officer’s action during an altercation at a New York City immigration courthouse.

title: Boeing Will Regain Ability to Certify Some Planes From F.A.A.
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration said the aerospace company will be allowed to approve some new 737 Max and 787 Dreamliner jets.

title: Hackers Steal Children’s Data and Photos from U.K. Nursery Chain
summary: Kido International, which runs nursery schools, reported the incident to the authorities after hackers posted sensitive data on the dark web and demanded a ransom.
